workflow.name: Discord setup guidelines üìú - get all channels & categories of a Discord server
workflow.description:
## üåü Test Your n8n Discord Connection!
Trying to connect n8n to your Discord server but not sure where to start? ü§î Setting up a Discord Bot and its credentials can be confusing. This workflow provides the perfect starting point, guiding you through the connection and running a test to fetch all channels from your server, confirming everything works!

---

## üéØ What This Does
This workflow is a "getting started" template designed to solve one primary problem: creating and verifying your first Discord connection in n8n.

Its main benefit is demystifying the Discord Bot setup process. It proves your connection is successful by connecting to your server and fetching a complete list of all channels and categories. It's the perfect first step for any n8n user, community manager, or developer who wants to build Discord automations but needs a clear, working starting point.

---

## üîÑ How It Works
Manual Trigger: You start the workflow by clicking 'Execute workflow'.

**Set Server ID:** A 'Set' node is pre-configured to hold your specific Discord Server ID.

**Get Channels List:** The Discord node uses your credentials and the Server ID to connect to Discord and retrieve a list of all channels and categories on that server.

**Separate Channels & Categories:** An 'IF' node automatically sorts the list, sending channels down one path and categories down another.

**Process & Merge:** Two 'Set' nodes clean up the data from each path, and a 'Merge' node combines them back into one organized list.

**Next Step!:** The workflow finishes at a 'NoOp' node. You can click the 'Merge' node to see the final output a full list of your server's channels.

## Nodes Used
- When clicking ‚ÄòExecute workflow‚Äô (Manual Trigger)
- Set - Server ID (Set)
- Get channels list (Discord)
- Separate Category & Channel (IF)
- Get Channels (Set)
- Get Server's Categories (Set)
- Merge (Merge)
- Next Step ! (NoOp)

---

## Setup Requirements üìú
Credentials: Discord Bot Token (created via the Discord Developer Portal).
**Accounts:** A Discord account.
**Specifics:**
- A Discord Server you own or have admin permissions for.
- Developer Mode enabled in your Discord client (to copy your Server ID).
- A Server ID from your server to test with.
- Estimated Setup Time: < 10 minutes.
### Set up steps
- **Part 1:** Create Your Discord Bot & Get Token
	- **Go to the Discord Developer Portal:** Navigate to discord.com/developers/applications and log in.
	- **Create New Application:** Click the New Application button in the top right. Give it a name (e.g., "n8n Bot") and click Create.
	- **Access Your Bot:** On the left-hand menu, click the Bot tab, then Add Bot.
	- **Get Your Bot Token:** Under the bot's username, find the Token section. Click Reset Token (and confirm) to reveal your bot's token.
	- **Copy the Token:** This is your secret credential. Copy this token and keep it safe.
- **Part 2:** Invite Your Bot to Your Server
Go to URL Generator: Back in the Discord Developer Portal, go to the OAuth2 tab and then URL Generator.
	- **Select Scopes:** In the Scopes box, check the bot checkbox.
	- **Set Permissions:** A new Bot Permissions box will appear. Check the View Channels permission. This is all that's needed for this workflow.
	- **Copy Invite URL:** Scroll down and copy the Generated URL.
	- **Invite Bot:** Paste this URL into a new browser tab. Select the server you want to add the bot to, click Continue, and then Authorize.
- **Part 3:** Add Credentials to n8n
	- **Open Credentials:** In n8n, go to Credentials > Create Credential.
	- **Select Credential Type:** Search for and select Discord Bot API.
	- **Paste Your Token:** Give your credential a 'Name' (e.g., "My Discord Bot"). Paste the Bot Token you copied from Part 1 into the Bot Token field.
	- **Save:** Click Save to store your new credentials.
	- **Link Credential:** Back in the workflow, click the Get channels list node. In the 'Credentials' parameter, select the credential you just created.
- **Part 4:** Configure and Test the Workflow
Enable Developer Mode: In your Discord desktop app, go to User Settings (the gear icon) > App Settings > Advanced and turn on Developer Mode.
	- **Copy Server ID:** Go to your Discord server, right-click on the server icon (on the left), and click Copy Server ID.
	- **Configure n8n Node:** Back in your n8n workflow, click the Set - Server ID node.
	- **Paste Server ID:** In the 'Value' field for server_id, replace the placeholder value with the Server ID you just copied.
	- **Execute Workflow:** Click Execute workflow in the top right corner.

If it succeeds, all nodes will turn green. Click the Merge node and select the 'Output' tab to see a complete JSON list of all channels and categories from your server. Congratulations, you're connected!

parameters.content:
## üéØ **Goal: Test Your Discord Connection**
This workflow demonstrates advanced Discord bot capabilities:
‚úì Fetch ALL channels from your Discord server at once
‚úì Automatically separate text channels from categories
‚úì Merge channel data with category metadata
‚úì Prepare structured data for bulk operations

Perfect for: Building multi-channel bots, server management automation, 
and advanced Discord integrations.

What you'll learn: Channel enumeration, conditional logic, data merging, 
and preparing for bulk message operations.

## ‚öôÔ∏è Workflow Configuration
### Get Server ID:
  ‚Ä¢ Enable Developer Mode: Discord Settings ‚Üí Advanced ‚Üí ‚òë Developer Mode
  ‚Ä¢ Right-click your server icon ‚Üí Copy Server ID
  ‚Ä¢ Example format: 012345678911121314(18-19 digit number)
### Configure "Set - Server ID" Node:
  1. Open the "Set - Server ID" node
  2. Replace the server_id value with YOUR server ID
  3. Keep the field name as "server_id" (used by next node)
### Configure "Get channels list" Node:
  ‚Ä¢ Credential: Select "Testing" (or your credential name)
  ‚Ä¢ Guild ID: Uses ={{ $json.server_id }} (from previous node)
  ‚Ä¢ Limit: 20 (increase if you have more than 20 channels)
  ‚Ä¢ Returns ALL channel types: Text, Voice, Categories, Forums
### Understanding the Flow:
  üìå "Separate Category & Channel" checks parent_id:
     ‚Ä¢ Has parent_id = Text Channel ‚Üí Goes to "Get Channels"
     ‚Ä¢ No parent_id = Category ‚Üí Goes to "Get Server's Categories"

  üìå "Merge" combines both paths:
     ‚Ä¢ Matches channels to their parent categories
     ‚Ä¢ Creates complete channel + category metadata
     ‚Ä¢ Output: [{ channel_name, channe_id, category_name, category_id, last_message_id }]
### Test the Workflow:
  1. Click "Execute workflow" (top-right)
  2. Check each node for green success checkmarks
  3. Click "Merge" node ‚Üí View output to see combined data
  4. You should see channels grouped by category

## ü§î Troubleshooting Guide
### Error 401 (Invalid Token):
  Problem: Your Bot Token in n8n is wrong
  ‚úì Fix: Reset token in Discord Developer Portal ‚Üí Bot ‚Üí Reset Token
  ‚úì Update your n8n credential with new token
### Error 403 (Missing Access):
  Problem: Bot doesn't have View Channels permission
  ‚úì Fix: Server Settings ‚Üí Roles ‚Üí Enable "View Channels" for bot role
  ‚úì Check channel-specific permissions if needed
### Error 404 (Not Found):
  Problem: Server (ID) is incorrect
  ‚úì Fix: Double-check Server (ID) in "Set - Server ID" node
  ‚úì Enable Developer Mode: Settings > Advanced > Developer Mode
  ‚úì Right-click server ‚Üí Copy Server ID
### Empty Results from "Get channels list":
  Problem: Bot not in server or no channels visible
  ‚úì Fix: Verify bot is invited to the server
  ‚úì Check bot can see at least one channel
  ‚úì Ensure limit is set high enough (default: 20)
### Merge Node Returns No Data:
  Problem: category_id mismatch between branches
  ‚úì Fix: Check "Get Channels" has parent_id ‚Üí category_id
  ‚úì Verify "Get Server's Categories" has matching category_id

### Part 1: Create Bot & Get Token
  1. Go to Discord Developer Portal ‚Üí Applications
  2. Click "New Application" ‚Üí Name your bot
  3. Navigate to "Bot" tab ‚Üí Click "Add Bot"
  4. Under Token section ‚Üí Click "Reset Token"
  5. COPY THE TOKEN IMMEDIATELY (you won't see it again!)
  6. Keep this token secure - treat it like a password

### Part 2: Invite Bot to Your Server
  1. Go to OAuth2 ‚Üí URL Generator
  2. Scopes section: ‚òë bot
  3. Bot Permissions: 
     ‚òë View Channels (required for v1.2)
     ‚òë Read Message History (for future extensions)
     ‚òë Send Messages (if you add messaging later)
  4. Copy the generated URL
  5. Paste in browser ‚Üí Select your server ‚Üí Authorize
  6. Verify bot appears in member list (may show as offline)

### Part 3: Add Credentials to n8n
  1. In n8n: Click "Credentials" (top-right) ‚Üí Create New
  2. Search for "Discord Bot API" ‚Üí Select it
  3. Credential Name: "Testing" (or match what's in workflow)
  4. Bot Token field: Paste the token from Part 1
  5. Click "Save" ‚Üí Test connection if available
  6. Use this credential in all Discord nodes

## üôè Thank You for Trying This Workflow!
Your time and trust mean a lot! I truly appreciate you using this 
advanced Discord template.
### Your feedback shapes future updates:
- üí° Suggestions for improvement
- üÜï Ideas for new features  
- üìù Requests for other automation workflows
#### Please share your thoughts! Every idea helps shape the next update.
### üôã‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Join & Follow For More Free Templates!
- #### Discord Community: We Work Together
‚Üí https://discord.gg/sEHaKcqBWY
Get help, share builds, collaborate!
- #### Facebook Fanpage: Automation Together
‚Üí facebook.com/profile.php?id=61581574203648
  Daily tips, tutorials, and updates
- #### Youtube Channel: Automation Together
‚Üí youtube.com/@AutomationTogether
Video guides for all templates
### Thank you again for being part of this journey! üöÄ
### Together, we automate better! ü§ñ‚ú®

### **Change Server ID:**
  ‚Ä¢ Update "Set - Server ID" node with different server
  ‚Ä¢ Bot must be invited to that server first
  ‚Ä¢ You can duplicate workflow for multiple servers

### **Advanced: Multi-Server Operations:**
  1. Replace "Set - Server ID" with "Code" node
  2. Create array: [server_id_1, server_id_2, ...]
  3. Add "Loop Over Items" before "Get channels list"
  4. Process multiple servers in one execution

### **Pro Tips:**
  ‚ö†Ô∏è Known Issue: "channe_id" has typo (missing 'l')
     ‚Ä¢ Keep it for compatibility with existing workflows
     ‚Ä¢ Or fix: Change in "Get Channels" node to "channel_id"
  
  üí° The parent_id logic is clever:
     ‚Ä¢ Categories have no parent (they ARE parents)
     ‚Ä¢ Text channels reference their category as parent
     ‚Ä¢ This is Discord's native structure

### **Extend "Next Step !" Placeholder:**
  Current workflow stops at data merging. You can add:
  
  üí¨ Send Messages to All Channels:
     ‚Ä¢ Add "Split In Batches" after Merge
     ‚Ä¢ Add "Discord: Send message" inside loop
     ‚Ä¢ Use ={{ $json.channe_id }} (note the typo!)
  
  üìä Export to Spreadsheet:
     ‚Ä¢ Add "Google Sheets" or "Excel" node
     ‚Ä¢ Map fields: channel_name, category_name, etc.
     ‚Ä¢ Great for server documentation
  
  üîç Fetch Last Messages:
     ‚Ä¢ Add IF node: Check last_message_id not empty
     ‚Ä¢ Add "Discord: Get message" node
     ‚Ä¢ Use ={{ $json.last_message_id }}
  
  üéØ Category-Based Actions:
     ‚Ä¢ Add Switch node based on category_name
     ‚Ä¢ Route to different actions per category
     ‚Ä¢ Example: Announcements ‚Üí Log, Support ‚Üí Alert

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
